required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Berry Peel Intake on Glucose Metabolism in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Berry Peel Intake on Glucose Metabolism in Healthy Subjects

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to investigate the effect of a 4-weeks intake of berry peel powder on fasting and postprandial glucose metabolism and inflammatory markers. The berry peel product will be compared with a placebo in a single-blind, cross-over design. Furthermore, inflammation-related peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) genes expression, appetite and cognitive performance will be included as a pilot study. Investigators hypothesize that long-term consumption of polyphenols and fibres of berry peel will exhibit both direct and indirect actions in healthy overweight subjects by improvement of glucose-associated markers as well as ameliorating inflammation. Moreover, above metabolic markers will correlated with improvements in inflammation-related PBMCs genes expression, subjective appetite and cognitive performance after long-term consumption of berry peel as a source of polyphenols.

primary_outcome.measure: Postprandial blood glucose response after acute intervention
primary_outcome.description: The capillary blood will be collected for glucose analysis using a glucometer.

primary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under curve (iAUC) blood glucose response after long-term intervention
primary_outcome.description: The capillary blood will be collected for glucose analysis using a glucometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial serum insulin response after acute intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The capillary blood will be collected for insulin analysis using commercial ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under curve (iAUC) serum insulin response after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The capillary blood will be collected for insulin analysis using commercial ELISA kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial subjective appetite rating after acute intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Appetite will be assessed using standard subjective 100mm visual analogue scaled (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under curve (iAUC) subjective appetite rating after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Appetite will be assessed using standard subjective 100mm visual analogue scaled (VAS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial C-reactive protein (CRP) after acute intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood will be collected for CRP analysis using ELISA commercial kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under curve (iAUC) of C-reactive protein (CRP) after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood will be collected for inflammatory analysis using ELISA commercial kits
The venous blood will be collected for adiponectin analysis using ELISA commercial kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial adiponectin after long-term intervention with berry peel
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood will be collected for adiponectin analysis using ELISA commercial kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) inflammatory genes expression after acute intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood samples will be taken for isolation of peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs). Extracted total RNA will then be used for running quantitative-PCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) inflammatory genes expression after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: -30 min. (Day-28 control); 180 min. (Day-28 control); -30 min. (Day-28 berry); 180 min. (Day-28 berry)
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood samples will be taken for isolation of peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs). Extracted total RNA will then be used for running quantitative-PCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Postprandial selective attention after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The selective attention will be assessed using a standardized software (Röd and Grön software) that measures wrong/right decisions and time of reaction when the subjects is faced with a challenging stimulus.
The venous blood will be collected for IL-6 analysis using ELISA commercial kits

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under curve (iAUC) of interleukin-6 (IL-6) after long-term intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The venous blood will be collected for IL-6 analysis using ELISA commercial kits

arm_group.description: Dietary supplement: Control drink As control, subjects are asked to consume 150 ml control drink containing equal amount of insoluble fiber (cellulose) and sugar for 28 days. In addition, on days-1 and 28, subjects will receive an acute challenge of placebo drink at our clinical facility. After 30 min. control drink intake, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g available carbohydrates.

Dietary supplement: Berry peel drink Subjects are asked to consume 150 ml experimental drink containing a berry peel fruit powder. In addition, on days-1 and 28, subjects will receive an acute challenge of test drink at our clinical facility. After 30 min. berry drink intake, subjects will be given standardized breakfast corresponding to 50 g available carbohydrates.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males and females
- Signed informed consent
- BMI 25-30 kg/m2
- Must be able to accept plant-based foods/drinks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below 18 years or above 40 years
- Smoking or using snuff
- vegetarian or vegan
- Stressed by venous blood sampling or previous experience of being difficult canulation

facility.name: Food for Health Science Centre (Medicon Village) - Lund University
